title: Examples
code: # install.packages("devtools") # devtools::install_github("openwashdata/wasteskipsblantyre") library(wasteskipsblantyre) library(tidyverse) library(sf) library(tmap) library(here) library(httr)

title: Examples
text: First, additional files including data sets specific census data Blantyre added package https://data.humdata.org. fictional article use spatial data therefore, data read simple features using sf-package can see following code junk.
code: # read in ward boundaries data census_boundaries <-    st_read(here::here("vignettes", "articles",                      "traditional-authorities", "Malawi_TA_2018.shp")) |>    st_as_sf()  # read in traditional authority population data census_data <- read_csv(here::here("vignettes", "articles",                                     "traditional-authorities",                                     "census_data.csv"))  # read waste skips locations into a simple feature (spatial vector data) # set coordinate reference system equal to one from census_boundaries sf_wsb <- st_as_sf(wasteskipsblantyre, coords = c('long', 'lat')) |>   st_set_crs(value = 4326) |>    st_transform(st_crs(census_boundaries))

title: Examples
text: Malawi eastern sub-Saharan state. article area city Blantyre explored depicted following map section. city divided 23 traditional authorities. article use areas explore emphasize data contained wasteskipsblantyre package. data set stores locations publicly accessible waste skips Blantyre (map ) collected 2021. addition, data 2018 Malawi Census population data set shared National Statistical Office used demographic analysis.
code: tmap_mode("view")  census_boundaries |>    filter(DIST_NAME == "Blantyre City") |>    qtm() census_boundaries |>    filter(DIST_NAME == "Blantyre City") |>   group_by(TA_NAME) |>    summarise(TA_CODE, OBJECTID) |>    qtm() +   qtm(sf_wsb)

title: Examples
text: context fictional article define hypothesis: number waste skips within traditional authorities (wards) correlates area authority.

title: Examples
text: location 53 public waste skips determined. Figure 1 visible number waste skips ward vary 0 4. average, 2.2 waste skips ward. Figure 1: Number waste skips ward. city center located west city. map , slight difference western north-eastern wards can recognized. Nevertheless, difficult see tendencies regard geographical location waste skips. , one say tend waste skips western part Blantyre, city center located.
code: # join data sets join_dataset <- st_join(census_boundaries, sf_wsb) |>    mutate(name = ifelse((DIST_NAME == "Blantyre City")*is.na(name),                        yes = TA_NAME, no = name)) |>    mutate(capacity_l = ifelse((DIST_NAME == "Blantyre City")*(is.na(capacity_l)),                               yes = 0, no =capacity_l)) |>    drop_na(capacity_l)  join_dataset |>   group_by(TA_NAME) |>    summarise(n = factor(sum(capacity_l)/7000)) |>   mutate(n = factor(n, levels = c(0:4))) |>    tm_shape() +   tm_borders() +   tm_fill(col = "n", palette = "RdPu", alpha = 0.7) +   qtm(sf_wsb)

title: Locations of Public Waste Skips in Blantyre, Malawi
text: code example shows use data prepare map R. Find examples prepared examples article (vignette("examples")). Screenshot interactive map OpenStreetMap layer.
code: library(wasteskipsblantyre) library(sf) library(tmap)  # read data set into a simple feature (spatial vector data) sf_wsb <- st_as_sf(wasteskipsblantyre, coords = c('long', 'lat'), crs = 4326) # set mapping mode to interactive ("view") tmap_mode("view") # create an interactive map  qtm(sf_wsb)
